Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown (partly worn) with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of grazing goat (head and foreleg remaining) to right; at right, hind leg of second goat to right; part of pendant and rising roundels and dotted cross as filling ornament; below, part of wide diagonal dividing band with broken maeander between lines; at right, perhaps tail of goat to right.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0078) (phase 2)
